author: alexandair
body: As custom snap-ins are not supported in PowerShell Core, is there still a need for #requires -snapin?

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: I just noticed today that although there is still some `#if !CORECLR` code there, the implementation of `PSSnapin` is completely missing. In general I would favour leaving things there for a backport to full .Net but since Snapins are not supported any more (which is good), I would be OK with removing all code related to Snapins.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Should we cleanup this? Please set right label or close the Issue.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee reviewed this and agree to remove `-pssnapin` from `#requires`

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: Additionally, per @JamesWTruher 's point we should add an error message when using `-pssnapin` that tells users that snap-ins are no longer supported, and that they should try to use `-module foo` instead of `-pssnapin foo` as it might fix their problem.

title: Should we remove the -pssnapin parameter for #requires statement?
